content.text: A Log Cost Report provides a cost analysis of costs incurred per unit based off the log type selected such as cost per distance in a vehicle. This guide will demonstrate how to generate a Log Cost Report.
1. Navigate to Reports > Logs > Log Cost.
Below are the available report criteria, make the appropriate selections using the drop down menu for each field.
2. Date Range.
The timeframe in which costs were incurred.
3. Asset Category Selection.
Report will generate results based off the selected Asset Category.
4. Primary Log.
Select the log type for the report to compare the cost to. Ex: Use distance to track cost per mile/km on a vehicle.
5. Secondary Log (optional).
Additional log to support primary log. Ex: Fuel is used as a secondary log to track fuel used per distance.
6. Display report in.
Toggle between Kilometers and Miles.
7. Show Chart.
Toggle on and off to display cost chart on report.

Select  

The report populates based on selected criteria and is displayed above the report and is now available to be exported:



To change any of the report criteria, select.
A Log Detail Report provides an overview of the logs entered within a defined time period. This guide will demonstrate how to generate a Log Detail Report.
1. Navigate to Reports > Logs > Log Detail.
Below are the available report criteria, make the appropriate selections using the drop down menu for each field.
2. Date Range.
The timeframe in which logs were entered.
3. Log Type.
Select which Log Type to generate results for.
4. Asset Selection (optional).
Generate results specific to a particular Asset(s).
5. Display report in.
Toggle between Kilometers and Miles when reporting by distance.
6. Show Chart.
Toggle on and off to display chart on report.

Select  

The report populates based on selected criteria and is displayed above the report and is now available to be exported:



To change any of the report criteria, select.
